alert.note: Alert for New Madrid; Stoddard (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 22 at 5:28AM CST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Fulton, New Madrid and southern Stoddard Counties through 615 AM CST... At 527 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Dudley to near Holcomb to near Leachville. Movement was east at 70 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Bernie, Clarkton and Gideon around 535 AM CST. Portageville around 545 AM CST. Other locations in the path of these storms include Marston, Canalou, Matthews and Farrenburg. This includes Interstate 55 between Mile Markers 33 and 63. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Paducah. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CST for western Kentucky...and southeastern Missouri.
